column4: X/gnome seems to be crashing or freezing during login.  does anyone know how I can find out what is causing that?
log into a failsafe session and examine ~/.xsession-errors
i did that, but nothing looks too problematic there
have you been able to login successfully before this problem occurred, or is this a fresh installation?
i was able to successfully log in in hardy, but i just upgraded to intrepid (i know this isn't the right channel).  my laptop runs intrepid fine, but i cna't log in to my desktop now
i tried making a new user also...no luck
perhaps, but i've had it working on several other computers.  i was just hoping for a way to figure out what is actually crashing so i can remove it

the .xsession-errors file looks the same as another computer i have except it just stops half way through.  the last line is "x-session-manager[6702]: WARNING: Application 'gnome-wm.desktop' failed to regi..."
you could reset your gnome configuration with gconftool --recursive-unset /
i made a brand new user so that i could test with default settings and it still didn't work
i'm just not sure how to troubleshoot this one
i have now killed every process running by the user attempting to log in.  however, the screen is still frozen.  perhaps gdm itself crashes?
you can bypass gdm to check: Ctrl-Alt-F2 for text mode, log in and run startx
ctrl-alt-f2 doesn't work, the keyboard is unresponsive
i am ssh'ing into the machine to try things
i will try to kill x and start again
